name: Telekinetic Lift
effect: An object weighing less than 20 pounds responds to telekinetic impulse, rising to hover 3 feet above the ground. The object can be pushed or rotated while levitated without interrupting the spell.

scaling.Maximum Weight: Additional 10 pounds for every point of willpower above 12.
scaling.Maximum Levitation Height: Additional 3 feet for every point of willpower above 12.

name: Telemanipulation
effect: Via subtle telekinetic impulses, the caster manipulates a target weighing less than 2 pounds with great precision, moving or rotating it at will. The object moves at a maximum speed of 5 ft/s and may not be rotated in such a way that any part of its outer boundary exceeds maximum speed relative to the center of mass. There is no limit to how many times this spell may be cast upon the same object or how much weight may be moved, provided all casters act in concert.

scaling.Maximum Weight: Additional 2 pounds per point of willpower above 15.
scaling.upcast: The caster may double or triple AP costs associated with the spell to double or triple the maximum weight.
scaling.dualcast: The caster doubles the AP used to double maximum object weight.

name: Lesser Telekinetic Pull
effect: A target weighing less than 20 pounds is drawn to the beckoning fingers of the caster's outstretched hand, at a rate of 2 ft/s.

scaling.Maximum Weight: Additional 5 pounds for every point of willpower above 13.
scaling.Maximum Speed: Additional 1 ft/s for every point of willpower above 13.

name: Greater Telekinetic Pull
effect: A target weighing less than 250 pounds is drawn towards the midpoint of the caster's outstretched hands, at a rate of 10 ft/s.

scaling.Maximum Weight: Additional 50 pounds for every point of willpower above 14.

name: Telekinetic Throw
effect: An object within range (that is also subject to a telekinetic positioning spell you have cast) is launched towards a destination you choose. You impart momentum to the object equal to your willpower score times the amount of AP used to cast the spell. The object's velocity (in feet per second) is equal to the object's momentum divided by its mass in pounds, times two. If used offensively, you must roll for accuracy (against the target's MIT) to determine if the object hits. On a hit, the object deals damage equal to one third of its momentum. The damage type is bludgeoning, unless the object is appropriately shaped (as ruled by the DM) to deal piercing damage. This spell can be upcast to use up to 5 AP.

scaling.upcast: Increase AP cost in increments of 1, to a maximum of +3.

name: Shockwave
effect: With a blast of psionic power, the caster deals 1d8 force damage to both allies and enemies within the radius, knocking them back by 5 feet and causing them to fall prone. Targets in the affected area make a strength saving throw equal to the caster's willpower stat. On success, targets take half damage and are not knocked prone.

scaling.Damage: Additional 1 damage for every point of willpower above 15.
scaling.dualcast: Radius and knockback distance are increased to 10 feet, and damage is increased by 1d8.

name: Telempathy
effect: You reach out and place the palms of your hands on either side of the target's head. While so positioned, you experience the emotions of the target as if they were your own. By mutual agreement, the target may also experience your emotions as well.

name: Minor Telepathy
effect: You reach out and place your palm upon your target's forehead. In so doing, you establish a psychic connection and may read their thoughts, including those that the being is unable or unwilling to articulate. You may also impart your own thoughts into their mind. The spell lasts for as long as you maintain physical contact and continue concentration. If the target is unwilling, they may make a DT 15 willpower saving throw to resist. If successful, they reject your contact and have advantage on all willpower saving throws against you for the next 24 hours.

scaling.Difficulty: The DT of the resistance saving throw is increased by 1 for each point of willpower above 13.

note: This spell allows you to view the target's active thoughts, but does not allow you to probe their memories or overcome brainwashing.

name: Major Telepathy
effect: You establish a psychic connection with a being within range that you can see. You may read their thoughts, including those that the being is unable or unwilling to articulate. You may also impart your own thoughts into their mind. The spell lasts for as long as you continue concentration, or until the target breaks line of sight for ten minutes. If the target is unwilling, they may make a DT 15 willpower saving throw to resist. If successful, they reject your contact and have advantage on all willpower saving throws against you for the next 24 hours.

scaling.Difficulty: The DT of the resistance saving throw is increased by 1 for every point of willpower above 16.

name: Esoteric Telepathy
effect: You gain the ability to read the thoughts of an entity known to you by name. You may expend 1 AP to project your thoughts into the entity's mind at will. For 2 AP, you may choose to experience the world through their eyes and ears. If at any point they become aware of your presence within their mind, they may make a willpower saving throw to re

name: Psychic Sight
effect: You see and hear through the senses of someone you can see, from a first person perspective. If the target has not consented to psychic contact, they make a DT 12 perception saving throw to detect your presence. Succeeding this, they may make an additional DT 15 willpower to resist. If this check succeeds, the spell ends and they have advantage on similar checks against you. If this check fails, they may make a DT 12 intelligence check to realize that they can interfere with the spell by closing their eyes.

scaling.Range: Additional 50 feet of range per point of willpower above 14.
scaling.Difficulty: DT of perception and willpower checks are increased by 1 for every point of willpower above 14.

note: The spell is not forbidden, but its practice is illegal when used to conduct espionage.

name: Mind Control
effect: The caster takes full control of being they can see within range. You automatically gain the psychic sight and major telepathy. The target makes a DT 10 perception check to realize they are being psychically dominated. If the target succeeds, they may make an additional DT 18 willpower check to resist your control. If they succeed this check, the spell ends and they have advantage on similar checks against you. If it fails, they may make additional attempts to resist at the end of each of their combat turns, or before making actions significantly against their interests. Additionally, if the target is aware that they are being dominated, they may give subtle tells such as speaking with unnatural vocal inflections or eye twitches.

scaling.Range: Additional 50 feet of range per point of willpower above 18.
scaling.Difficulty: The difficulty of recognition and resistance checks are modified by the difference between the caster and target's combined intelligence and charisma scores. The DT can decrease if the target is more intelligent or charismatic than the caster.

name: Unimind
effect: While the spell is in effect, all participants share a single mind such that the thoughts and emotions of each participant are instantaneously apparent to all others. Participants other than the caster must possess at least 15 charisma in order to participate in the ritual. The AP cost is divided between all participants.

scaling.Participation: The minimum charisma is decreased by 1 for each point of willpower above 17.
